codes.name: Data Privacy
codes.description: Concerns and issues about the collection, usage, security, and ownership of personal and sensitive data by AI systems.

codes.name: Facial Recognition
codes.description: Discussion around the use of facial recognition technology by AI, its impacts on privacy, and associated ethical considerations.

codes.name: Ethical Concerns
codes.description: Issues related to the ethical implications of AI development and deployment, including biases, fairness, and the misuse of AI technologies.

codes.name: Surveillance
codes.description: Concerns about the use of AI for monitoring and tracking individuals, particularly in the contexts of government and corporate surveillance.

codes.name: Bias in AI
codes.description: Discussion on biases present in data and AI systems, their impacts on decision-making, and the need for fairness and equity in AI models.

codes.name: AI in Government Use
codes.description: Discussion about government utilization of AI for various purposes, including implications on privacy, surveillance, and regulatory challenges.

codes.name: Regulations and Compliance
codes.description: Focus on the need for legal frameworks, compliance with data protection laws, and regulations to ensure ethical AI use.

codes.name: AI Misuse and Security Risks
codes.description: Concerns related to the potential for AI technologies to be misused for malicious purposes, including hacking, fraud, and unauthorized data access.

codes.name: User Consent and Control
codes.description: Emphasis on the importance of obtaining user consent for data collection, giving users control over their data, and ensuring transparency in AI practices.
